intro: Haplosticha zosterifolia, commonly known as the sea holly, is a marine flowering plant found in coastal areas. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and blue or purple flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or rocky substrates and is often found in intertidal zones. Its reproductive structures are adapted to withstand harsh coastal conditions. Haplosticha zosterifolia plays a role in stabilizing shorelines and providing habitat for small marine organisms.
